programme.title: WTA Final: Linz
programme.desc: Dayana Yastremska ends a near three-year wait to compete for a WTA title, as the Ukrainian faces the number four seed Ekaterina Alexandrova in the Upper Austria Ladies Linz final. (02.02)

programme.desc: In an all-American final at the Adelaide International, Jessica Pegula and Madison Keys contest the third instalment of their rivalry, with the head-to-head record at one apiece. (11.01)

programme.title: WTA Final: Charleston
programme.desc: Jessica Pegula enters her first Charleston Open final in her eighth appearance at the WTA 500 event, as the top seed faces 2020 Australian Open champion Sofia Kenin. (06.04)

programme.title: WTA Final: Bad Homburg
programme.desc: Contesting her first final in more than a year, and a first on grass, Iga Swiatek meets top seed Jessica Pegula for the Bad Homburg title. Swiatek leads the head-to-head record. (28.06)

programme.title: WTA Final: Ningbo
programme.desc: Out to strengthen her bid to reach the WTA Finals, Elena Rybakina targets WTA 500 glory in the Ningbo final as the world number nine meets fellow top-10 star Ekaterina Alexandrova. (19.10)

programme.desc: Aryna Sabalenka and Elena Rybakina - both undefeated in Riyadh - bid to become a first-time WTA Finals champion. This is the 14th meeting between the two, with Sabalenka 8-5 ahead. (08.11)

programme.title: WTA Final: Doha
programme.desc: Jelena Ostapenko's near seven-year wait to vie for a WTA 1000 title ends in Doha, as the former Grand Slam champion faces 23-year-old American Amanda Anisimova in an unseeded final. (15.02)

programme.title: WTA Final: Cincinnati
programme.desc: Six-time Grand Slam champion Iga Swiatek faces Jasmine Paolini for the Cincinnati title. In what will be Swiatek's 13th WTA 1000 final, Paolini is competing in just her third. (18.08)

programme.title: WTA Final: Seoul

programme.title: WTA Final: Madrid
programme.desc: In a repeat of the 2023 US Open final, two-time Madrid champion Aryna Sabalenka eyes another marquee title against Coco Gauff, who won their only prior clay-court meeting. (03.05)

programme.title: Serena v Hingis 1999
programme.desc: Twenty-two years before Emma Raducanu's triumph over Leylah Fernandez, Serena Williams and Martina Hingis locked horns in an all-teenage final at the 1999 US Open in the women's singles.

programme.title: Graf v Seles 1995
programme.desc: Two greats of professional tennis contested the 1995 women's singles final at the US Open, as Monica Seles - returning from a terrifying on-court ordeal in 1993 - faced Steffi Graf.

programme.title: Navratilova v Evert 1984
programme.desc: Martina Navratilova completed her dominant march to the 1984 US Open women's title, as she defeated the home favourite Chris Evert in a fervent Flushing Meadows atmosphere.

programme.title: Austin v Evert 1979
programme.desc: A 16-year-old Tracy Austin became the youngest US Open champion at the 1979 championships after defeating the four-time defending champion Chris Evert.

programme.title: ATP Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper competes in his maiden ATP Masters 1000 final at Indian Wells as the top-10 bound Brit faces Holger Rune. Draper knocked out Carlos Alcaraz in the last four. (16.03)

programme.title: ATP Final: Toronto
programme.desc: Ben Shelton features in his first ATP Masters final as the 22-year-old eyes world number six status against Karen Khachanov, who ends a seven-year wait to compete on this stage. (07.08)

programme.title: ATP Final: Washington
programme.desc: Into his second final of 2025, Australian world number 13 Alex de Minaur meets Spaniard Alejandro Davidovich Fokina. De Minaur fell short in the Washington final back in 2018. (27.07)

programme.title: ATP Final: Stuttgart
programme.desc: In a blockbuster Stuttgart final, world number three Alexander Zverev competes for a maiden grass-court title against second seed Taylor Fritz, who leads the head to head 7-5. (15.06)

programme.title: ATP Final: Adelaide
programme.desc: Number two seed Sebastian Korda of America stands between Felix Auger-Aliassime and a sixth tour-level title for the Canadian, as the two clash in the Adelaide International final. (11.01)

programme.title: ATP Final: Geneva
programme.desc: A chance for Novak Djokovic to join Jimmy Connors and Roger Federer in winning a 100th tour-level title, as the 38-year-old Serb battles Hubert Hurkacz in the Geneva Open final. (24.05)

programme.title: ATP Final: Athens
programme.desc: A win away from securing a dream debut appearance at the ATP Finals, Lorenzo Musetti must overcome Novak Djokovic to book his spot in Turin. Djokovic eyes his 101st title in Athens. (08.11)

programme.title: ATP Final: Munich
programme.desc: Entering his fourth ATP final, second seed Ben Shelton faces off with first seed Alexander Zverev - chasing his third BMW Open crown - in the Munich final. (20.04)

programme.title: ATP Final: Beijing
programme.desc: A victor is crowned at the China Open, as world number two Jannik Sinner - chasing his third title of 2025 - faces 19-year-old Learner Tien, who enters his first tour-level final. (01.10)

programme.title: ATP Final: Vienna
programme.desc: In a rematch of the Australian Open final, Jannik Sinner and Alexander Zverev meet in Vienna. Sinner, appearing in his eighth final of 2025, bids to deny Zverev a second title here. (26.10)

programme.title: ATP Final: Paris

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In pursuit of the first of her three Toronto titles, Serena Williams came across serial winner Monica Seles, a four-time winner in her own right, in the 2001 semi-finals.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Roaring back from long-term injury, former champion Kim Clijsters would meet top seed and world number one Lindsay Davenport in the 2005 Indian Wells final.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In a three-hour test of wills, Justine Henin was bidding to close an up-and-down year with the defence of her WTA Finals title against Maria Sharapova in 2007.

programme.desc: In 2016, Michael Van Gerwen and Raymond Van Barneveld delivered a World Championship thriller on the Alexandra Palace stage. Revisit this epic encounter in London. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: Taylor v Painter 2004
programme.desc: Trailing Kevin Painter 4-1, a ninth World Championship title looked out of reach for Phil Taylor. Cue a miraculous recovery and a breathtaking sudden death leg. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: Taylor v Wright 2017
programme.desc: Appearing for the final time on the Winter Gardens stage, revisit Phil Taylor's World Matchplay Final with Peter Wright in 2017. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: Beaton v Taylor QF 2010
programme.desc: In the quarter-final of the 2010 Grand Slam of Darts, Steve Beaton staged an incredible comeback, overcoming Phil Taylor. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: WDC QF: Manley v Lewis
programme.desc: During the World Championship in 2006, Peter Manley and Adrian Lewis clashed in an ill-tempered quarter-final at the Circus Tavern. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: Wld Champs Final: Taylor v RVB 07'
programme.desc: Take a look back at the 2007 World Championship final between Phil Taylor and Raymond Van Barneveld. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: PDC Classics 2023
programme.desc: Overcoming the nerves of a TV debut, Canadian youngster Dawson Murschell announced himself to the world during this classic contest against James Wade in 2017. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: PDC Classics 2023
programme.desc: In a classic at the World Matchplay in July 2011, Simon Whitlock let a seemingly unassailable lead slip when Andy Hamilton recovered from a 15-8 deficit. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: PDC Classics 2023
programme.desc: Revisit the 2014 PDC World Darts Championship where Phil Taylor suffered a shock second-round defeat to then unknown Michael Smith. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: WDC 2026: The Story So Far
programme.desc: The evening session of day five sees Jonny Clayton get up and running, meeting Adam Lipscombe. The 09-10 runner-up Simon Whitlock faces Connor Scutt as Dirk van Duijvenbode plays. (15.12)

programme.title: WDC 2026: The Story So Far
programme.desc: Former World Darts Championship semi-finalists Chris Dobey and Scott Williams compete during day six's afternoon session, facing Xiaochen Zong and Paolo Nebrida respectively. (16.12)

programme.title: WDC 2026: The Story So Far
programme.desc: Gerwyn Price headlines a blockbuster day six evening line-up against Adam Gawlas. Danny Noppert meets fellow Dutchman Jurjen van der Velde as Jose de Sousa plays Ricardo Pietreczko. (16.12)

programme.title: WDC 2026: The Story So Far
programme.desc: As Raymond van Barneveld's record-equalling 33rd world championship commences on day seven, James Wade plays Ryusei Azemoto and Martin Schindler faces Stephen Burton. (17.12)

programme.title: WDC 2026: The Story So Far
programme.desc: Former World Grand Prix winner Mike De Decker plays debutant David Munyua, the first Kenyan to compete here, during the afternoon of day eight. Callan Rydz meets Patrik Kovacs. (18.12)

programme.title: WDC 2026: The Story So Far
programme.desc: Michael van Gerwen's pursuit of a fourth world championship crown begins in the evening of day eight against Mitsuhiko Tatsunami, as Fallon Sherrock collides with Dave Chisnall. (18.12)

programme.title: WDC 2026: The Story So Far
programme.desc: During the afternoon session on day nine, Josh Rock opens his campaign against qualifier Gemma Hayter. Kevin Doets faces Matthew Dennant and Mickey Mansell meets Leonard Gates. (19.12)

programme.title: WDC 2026: The Story So Far
programme.desc: Beau Greaves headlines day nine's evening session against Daryl Gurney, while two-time semi-finalist Nathan Aspinall battles PDC Asian Championship winner Lourence Ilagan. (19.12)

programme.title: PDC Classics 2023
programme.desc: Revisit Phil Taylor's fourth World Championship victory, achieved at the 1996 PDC World Championship in victory over rival Dennis Priestley. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: Beyond The Oche
programme.desc: Some of darts' top stars - including Luke Humphries, Nathan Aspinall, Michael Smith and Peter Wright - are joined by Abigail Davies as they speak candidly about their own mental health.

programme.title: The Luke Littler Effect
programme.desc: Luke Littler has transformed darts, taking the sport global and inspiring a new generation to play. But what does this mean for darts and just how big can the 'Luke Littler Effect' become?

programme.title: WDC 2026: The Story So Far
programme.desc: The evening session of day five sees Jonny Clayton get up and running, meeting Adam Lipscombe. The 09-10 runner-up Simon Whitlock faces Connor Scutt as Dirk van Duijvenbode plays. (15.12)

programme.desc: In this special Christmas episode, Freddie, Chris and Paddy play 'car secret Santa' for a festive road trip across Britain transporting a giant Christmas tree to a winter wonderland.

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey: The Christmas Announcement
programme.desc: The hit sitcom returns for a festive special. Nessa and the Wests head east with some help from Dave and his coach - meanwhile, Mick is preoccupied with his new love.

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Gavin starts his job in Cardiff and Smithy has to come to terms with not living near his best friend, but Neil's christening offers an opportunity for everyone to reunite.

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Dave is unhappy about Nessa's plans to visit Essex, Stacey ensures Gavin sticks to his promise while she finds a new job, and Pam and Mick host a beer and curry night.

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: The Essex boys plan a big night out in Cardiff and a sleepover at Bryn's, but Smithy is concerned about seeing Nessa again. Meanwhile, Stacey tells Gavin about a worrying discovery.

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Gavin is uncomfortable with Gwen and Bryn knowing the details of his and Stacey's sex life. Pete and Dawn prepare to renew their vows.

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Bank Holiday Monday sees the Essex mob arrive for a day at the beach in Barry, where Gavin has a heart-to-heart with his dad, while Dave finds Nessa and Smithy enjoying the fair.

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: With preparations for the wedding in full swing, Stacey has news for Gavin. Bryn and Jason put their big secret to bed, and Smithy has a final chat with Nessa.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Rejoice! A Christmas Special: It's Christmas, so time to rejoice with Sandi Toksvig and guests Holly Walsh, Justin Moorhouse, Chris McCausland and Alan Davies.

programme.title: Would I Lie To You At Christmas
programme.desc: Sorting the fact from the fiction in this festive special are guests Jim Broadbent, Ardal O'Hanlon, Rose Matafeo and Angela Rippon.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and co ham it up with James Acaster, Gary Delaney, Zoe Lyons and Josh Widdicombe as they ridicule what's hogging the headlines. Yes, Piggate is in the news!

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: UKIP and Mr Corbyn are the easy targets for satirical sharpshooters Dara O Briain, Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons, James Acaster, Rob Beckett, Ellie Taylor and Josh Widdicombe.

programme.title: Would I Lie To You?
programme.desc: At Christmas: Captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by Gloria Hunniford, Guz Khan, Christopher Eccleston and Sophie Willan, but are they telling the truth or making it all up?

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Uncharted Waters. As the new summer mining season begins, gold in Nome is drying up, pushing miners to extreme new locations in a desperate search for gold. S6, Ep1

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Cruel Summer. The miners of Nome continue their search for new gold. Whilst Zeke and Emily head to Sledge Island, Shawn continues his dreams of gold at the Bluff. S6, Ep2

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: A disastrous fire could ruin the Gold Timers' season before it has even begun. The Ferals are forced to launch a rescue mission when Rob goes missing. S7, Ep3

programme.title: Mysteries Of The Deep
programme.desc: The Bermuda Triangle Conspiracy. Jeremy Wade investigates if one of the Bermuda Triangle's most infamous disappearances was part of a conspiracy by a secret agent at war with the US. S1, Ep4

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Rogue Wave Juggernaut. A rare weather event churns up some dangerous waves. Josh and Casey face a 55-foot monster, while Jake risks capsizing to repair his rudder in unruly seas. S16, Ep19

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A Problem Like Maria. As the super snow-moon storm peaks, the Cornelia Marie's deck becomes a gauntlet for Josh and a greenhorn. Plus, Junior fights a sea-flea infestation. S16, Ep20

programme.title: Mystery At Blind Frog Ranch
programme.desc: Aztec Evidence. When an underground tsunami floods the cavern system, Duane and his team enter it from higher ground - discovering evidence of Aztec artifacts. S3, Ep3

programme.title: Expedition Unknown
programme.desc: Mysteries Of Bermuda Triangle. Josh Gates dives into the mysteries of the Bermuda Triangle. He goes to the ocean floor, the skies and space to explore its intriguing disappearances. S6, Ep10

programme.title: Expedition Unknown
programme.desc: Revealing The Triangle. To conclude his epic investigation, Josh Gates uses cutting-edge technology to investigate the Bermuda Triangle's most infamous shipwreck and lost flights. S6, Ep11

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: A Golden Opportunity. The Raneys convert an old barn into a commercial fishing kitchen. But when Marty is forced to quarantine, Matt and Misty make a golden discovery. S4, Ep1

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Legend Returns. Mick's mining operation grinds to a halt when the conveyor belt rips on a piece of machinery. In need of cash, he heads out of town on another job. S1, Ep3

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Attack Of The Cacti. After the birth of Daniel's child, the Rookies return to Coober Pedy. Kelly and Al battle a deadly cactus in their hunt for the most valuable opal. S1, Ep4

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Cain And Abel. The fleet is beset by crisis. Skipper Phil fights for his life as his sons fight each other, and sick of false promises, Captain Sig's brother thinks of quitting. S6, Ep13

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Redemption Day. On the Time Bandit, Scott steps up to challenge Mike for the Captain's spot. But all skipper Andy sees is his deck start to disintegrate. S6, Ep14

programme.title: Building Off The Grid
programme.desc: North Pole. In North Pole, Alaska, the mayor builds a remote family cabin about 16-miles from the nearest town. The harsh cold conditions and location are a big challenge. S1, Ep3

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Appalachian Christmas Treehouse. The crew treks to the Blue Ridge Mountains to build a treehouse for carpenter Mike for hosting the wild Appalachian Breaking Up Christmas tradition! S5, Ep16

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The Scrappers launch their season determined to find a huge gold haul. Meanwhile, new crew the Victoria Diggers may have stumbled on a million-dollar motherlode. S4, Ep2

programme.title: Naked And Afraid: Alone
programme.desc: Alone Man Up Or Bow Out. Trying to survive 21 days completely solo, All-Star survivalist Luke McLaughlin takes on the dangerous wilderness of South Africa. S1, Ep1

programme.title: Deadliest Catch

programme.desc: The Hot Tub Contamination: Leonard and Penny intervene when Sheldon and Amy have an argument. Howard and Bernadette are disturbed by unexpected guests.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Fetal Kick Catalyst: Penny meets her fans at a comic book convention. Sheldon and Amy host brunch at Penny's flat. Howard makes an impulsive purchase.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Veracity Elasticity: Leonard is upset when he finds out that Penny has been moving his collectables out of Sheldon's old room and into storage behind his back.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Brain Bowl Incubation: Sheldon tries to convince Amy that they should procreate. Raj feels embarrassed about what the new woman in his life does for a living.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Geology Elevation: Sheldon can't contain his jealousy when he hears that his university colleague, Bert the geologist, has won a prestigious fellowship.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Property Division Collision: Sheldon, Amy, Leonard and Penny attempt to divide up all their possessions. It doesn't go well.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Birthday Synchronicity: Sheldon and Amy try to celebrate her birthday with an intimate night at home but are interrupted when Bernadette goes into labour.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Holiday Summation: After spending Christmas apart, the gang gather at Penny and Leonard's flat and hear about Sheldon and Amy's terrible trip to Texas.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Romance Recalibration: Penny thinks that Leonard has stopped making an effort in their relationship, so she decides to go away for a spa weekend with Amy.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Emotion Detection Automation: Sheldon tests a new invention after hearing that it could help him to read people's emotions. Raj seeks dating advice.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Locomotion Reverberation: Leonard and Howard distract Sheldon with a trip to a historic railway when he slows their progress on the guidance system.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Allowance Evaporation: Amy is furious when she learns that Sheldon has shared intimate details of their relationship with his colleagues.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Comic-Con Conundrum: Cut off from his father's fortune, Raj appoints Sheldon to organise his finances. Penny considers joining the guys at Comic-Con.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Escape Hatch Identification: Leonard and Penny offer Sheldon's old room to Raj when he's forced to move out of his flat, leading to unexpected conflict.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Collaboration Fluctuation: Leonard, Penny and Raj settle into their new living arrangement, and Sheldon expresses an interest in Amy's professional life.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Recollection Dissipation: Sheldon collaborates on two projects - one with Leonard and Howard, plus another with Amy - pushing himself to the limit.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Separation Agitation: Howard and Bernadette are upset when they leave Halley at the nursery. Bert the geologist introduces his girlfriend to the gang.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Cognition Regeneration: Leonard isn't happy when he finds out that Penny is considering accepting a job offer from her ex-boyfriend Zack.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Gyroscopic Collapse: Amy is offered a fellowship at Princeton, Raj makes new living arrangements, and the guys' gyroscope project spins out of control.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Long Distance Dissonance: The gang worry when Sheldon's former admirer, Dr Ramona Nowitzki, turns up while Amy is away working at Princeton.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Faith Off: Homer gets a bucket of superglue stuck to his head and the only person who can remove it is a preacher (Don Cheadle), who inspires Bart to become a faith healer.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Kill Gil, Volumes I & II: The Simpsons are stuck with an unwanted house guest, Gil, at Christmas. And he stays for a whole year... until Marge throws him out on Christmas Eve.

programme.title: The Snowman
programme.desc: Raymond Briggs's classic animated tale of a little boy's snowman who comes to life and whisks him off to the North Pole for an adventure.

programme.title: The Snowman and the Snowdog
programme.desc: Charming animated sequel to Raymond Briggs's classic The Snowman. When a young boy and his mother move house, he builds a snowman and a snowdog who magically come to life.

programme.title: Gogglebox Festive Special
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers watch top Christmas telly, from Jamie's Easy Christmas to Top Gun: Maverick, First Dates at Christmas, Michael McIntyre's Christmas Wheel and much more.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: First Day: Smash hit comedy about four teenagers. Will (Simon Bird), whose parents have divorced, must move to a new area and change from private to comprehensive school.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Bunk Off: Will, Simon, Jay and Neil bunk off school. They go to Neil's house to get drunk, and Simon has a vodka-induced romantic revelation about his childhood sweetheart Carli.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Thorpe Park: After passing his driving test, Simon takes the boys on their first road trip: a day out at Thorpe Park, where Will disgraces himself on the roller coaster.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will Gets a Girlfriend: Will sees that going to a mixed-sex school isn't so bad when he pulls the most popular girl in the year above. But he alienates his hard-won new friends.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Caravan Club: The boys call Jay's bluff and go to the Camber Sands meeting of the Caravan Club to see if it really is a massive sex party. Jay's dad gives them advice about sex.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Xmas Party: It's the end of term and Will has been voted chairman of the Christmas prom committee, so he ropes in Simon, Jay and Neil to help get things organised.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Sian, who's 24, wants a man to drive her wild, who she can love more than her beloved car. And 33-year-old fashion entrepreneur Tansel is after a woman to settle down with.

programme.title: Gogglebox Festive Special
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers watch top Christmas telly, from Jamie's Easy Christmas to Top Gun: Maverick, First Dates at Christmas, Michael McIntyre's Christmas Wheel and much more.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Promposal: With Closet-Con imminent, Claire's on high alert and convinced there's a company mole. Phil goes vigilante when he and Gloria confront Alice for stealing her recipe.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Crazy Train: When Dede gets remarried, Manny convinces the family to take the train to the wedding. And Jay's ecstatic that Dede is moving on for good.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Conjugal Conjecture: The gang face an awkward morning after Sheldon's mother and Leonard's father share an evening together. Penny's family arrive in town.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Military Miniaturization: Howard has a meeting with Air Force representative Colonel Williams about the gyroscope he invented with Leonard and Sheldon.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Skinner's Sense of Snow: When a huge snowdrift engulfs the school, Bart leads the kids in a rebellion, gagging Principal Skinner and tying him to a chair as they run amok.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Kill Gil, Volumes I & II: The Simpsons are stuck with an unwanted house guest, Gil, at Christmas. And he stays for a whole year... until Marge throws him out on Christmas Eve.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Proposal Proposal: Amy must decide whether or not to marry Sheldon and gives him an answer to his proposal. Howard and Bernadette struggle with some unexpected news.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Retraction Reaction: Leonard angers the university during an embarrassing interview. Amy and Bernadette must hide their success from Sheldon and Howard.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Relaxation Integration: Amy tries to convince Sheldon that he has a more laid-back side. Raj and Stuart compete to woo Bernadette's new colleague Ruchi.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Explosion Implosion: Howard and Sheldon bond on a trip to the desert to launch a model rocket. Leonard is annoyed when his mother befriends Penny.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Collaboration Contamination: Sheldon and Raj ask Bernadette for advice about their jealousy when Amy and Howard decide to collaborate on a new project.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Proton Regeneration: Sheldon goes head-to-head with Wil Wheaton as they compete for the role of the new Professor Proton when the TV series has a reboot.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Geology Methodology: Sheldon and Bert collaborate on a research project, but Sheldon feels embarrassed to be associated with the study of geology.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Tesla Recoil: Leonard and Howard learn that Sheldon went to work with the military behind their backs. Bernadette thinks Ruchi's trying to steal her job.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Bitcoin Entanglement: Sheldon seeks revenge when the guys cut him out of a potentially valuable investment. A secret about Leonard and Penny is revealed.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Confidence Erosion: Sheldon and Amy try to use maths to make their wedding planning less stressful. Raj falls out with Howard.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Celebration Reverberation: Sheldon and Howard plan birthday celebrations for Amy and Halley. Leonard is stressed by a Christmas letter from his brother.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Matrimonial Metric: Sheldon and Amy secretly test their friends, to work out who should be best man and maid of honour at their wedding.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Solo Oscillation: Amy and Leonard bond over some experiments. Bert replaces Howard in his band. Penny gives Sheldon unexpected scientific inspiration.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Separation Triangulation: Raj gets into a domestic drama with his new date Nell and her estranged husband. Sheldon rents his old room back from Leonard.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Novelization Correlation: Amy appears on the Professor Proton show. Penny hates the idea that the female protagonist in Leonard's novel is based on her.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Neonatal Nomenclature: Bernadette's friends try various tactics to help her go into labour.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Athenaeum Allocation: Leonard jumps through hoops to secure the perfect wedding venue for Sheldon and Amy. Howard and Bernadette face a big decision.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Gates Excitation: The guys do everything in their power to meet Bill Gates when his firm has dealings with the pharmaceutical company Penny works for.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Tenant Disassociation: Leonard competes with Sheldon to become president of the tenants' association. Howard and Raj find a drone in the back garden.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Reclusive Potential: A brilliant scientist invites Sheldon to his isolated cabin, and Leonard, Raj and Howard go along for the trip.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Comet Polarization: Sheldon isn't pleased by the comic book shop's new-found popularity. Raj tries to take the credit for Penny's astronomical discovery.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Monetary Insufficiency: Sheldon goes to Las Vegas to try to win money for science. Penny and Bernadette take Amy shopping for a wedding dress.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Sibling Realignment: When Sheldon finds out that his mum won't come to his wedding unless he invites his brother Georgie, he and Leonard head to Texas.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Bow Tie Asymmetry: Everyone is focused on making sure that the arrangements for Amy and Sheldon's big day go according to plan - except the bride and groom.

programme.title: The Little Mermaid
programme.desc: (2023) Live action remake of the Disney classic with Halle Bailey and Melissa McCarthy. Can mermaid Ariel get a kiss from Prince Eric and keep her legs? Evil Aunt Ursula hopes not.

programme.title: Finding Father Christmas
programme.desc: A 16-year-old boy (Lenny Rush) goes on a quest to prove his dad wrong and that Father Christmas does exist. A star-studded, heart-warming drama also featuring Greg Davies and Stephen Fry.

programme.title: First Dates at Christmas
programme.desc: Martial artists, firefighters and professional princesses are on the festive menu as Fred opens the restaurant doors for singletons hoping to find Christmas romance in their stockings.

programme.desc: The leading news stories of the moment.

programme.title: Happiest Season
programme.desc: (2020) Kristen Stewart and Mackenzie Davis star as a couple who are about to lob an outing grenade into the family Christmas in Clea DuVall's darkly comic festive romance.

programme.title: The Favourite
programme.desc: (2018) Historical dark comedy starring an Oscar-winning Olivia Colman as eccentric monarch Queen Anne, with Rachel Weisz and Emma Stone vying to become her favourite.

programme.title: The Duke of Burgundy
programme.desc: (2014) Peter Strickland's acclaimed adult drama explores two lovers' fetishistic desires and the balance of power in their relationship. Starring Sidse Babett Knudsen and Chiara D'Anna.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Dr Who and the Daleks
programme.desc: (1965) A spin-off of the cult television series starring Peter Cushing. Backyard-inventor Dr Who finds himself stuck on the irradiated planet Skaro, home of the cold and metallic Daleks.

programme.title: Daleks Invasion Earth 2150 A.D.
programme.desc: (1966) A sci-fi classic with Peter Cushing. Dr Who travels to the future only to find the Daleks have conquered the Earth! Can he stop them nuking the planet's core? With Bernard Cribbins.

programme.title: Anastasia
programme.desc: (1997) Animated drama. When the Russian royal family is murdered, the sole surviving child is separated from her grandmother. Years later, conmen try to exploit the reward for her return.

programme.title: Cutthroat Island
programme.desc: (1995) Swashbuckling adventure. Geena Davis and Matthew Modine star as pirates racing to find the missing parts of their treasure map and beat an evil rival (Frank Langella) to the booty.

programme.title: Fisherman's Friends: One and All
programme.desc: (2022) Sea-shanty-singing comedy sequel with James Purefoy. The band are on tour but it's not all plain sailing. The label want Jim to replace his dead dad and Leadville just ain't woke.

programme.title: Wrath of Man
programme.desc: (2021) Jason Statham reunites with director Guy Ritchie to give it both barrels as a mysterious hardman working for a money truck firm that keeps getting hit. But is he an inside man?

programme.title: Sexy Beast
programme.desc: (2000) Jonathan Glazer's thriller with Ray Winstone, Ben Kingsley and Ian McShane. A criminal's blissful retirment is shattered by a psychopathic gangster who insists on one more job.

programme.title: Open Range
programme.desc: (2003) Kevin Costner's western with Robert Duvall and Michael Gambon. A small band of free grazers are forced to take on a local rancher and his hired thugs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Hue & Cry
programme.desc: (1947) The very first Ealing comedy is set in the post-war East End. A boy tries to catch a gang of thieves who are using his favourite comic to communicate their dastardly deeds.

programme.title: Monster House
programme.desc: (2006) Spooky animated caper with Maggie Gyllenhaal and Steve Buscemi. A young boy and his babysitter spy on the creepy neighbour. Did he really eat his wife?

programme.title: Miracle on 34th Street
programme.desc: (1994) Festive family drama. Richard Attenborough stars as a department store Santa who insists he's the real Santa Claus. But can he prove it in court?

programme.title: Evolution
programme.desc: (2001) Scary sci-fi comedy. Can David Duchovny, Julianne Moore and Orlando Jones save humanity from a rapidly evolving, predatory alien species? Well, DD used to be Fox Mulder, so...

programme.title: Cowboys & Aliens
programme.desc: (2011) Sci-fi western starring Daniel Craig and Harrison Ford. A brutal cattle baron and his amnesiac enemy must cease their feuding when a town is attacked by aliens.

programme.title: Mrs Harris Goes to Paris
programme.desc: (2022) Lesley Manville stars as a cleaner who saves up and heads to Paris to get herself a Dior couture dress, in director Anthony Fabian's fabulous, Oscar-nominated period comedy drama.

programme.title: The Invitation
programme.desc: (2022) Gothic horror with Nathalie Emmanuel. A struggling New York artist discovers she has rich British relatives and accepts an invitation to a wedding in Whitby. Well, blood is blood.

programme.title: Step Brothers
programme.desc: (2008) Outrageous comedy with Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly. When two 40-year-old man-children's parents marry, can the lads settle their differences and grow up? Strong language/nudity.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Anastasia
programme.desc: (1956) Historical drama. The Oscar-winning Ingrid Bergman stars as an amnesiac refugee who Yul Brynner tries to pass off as the daughter of the murdered Tsar of Russia, Nicholas II.

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan
programme.desc: (1984) It's time to put on make-up. It's time to light the lights. Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzy, the Blues one and the gang embark on a musical adventure as they try to make it on Broadway.

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: (1996) Brian Levant's festive all-action comedy. Arnold Schwarzenegger is on a mission to get his son (Jake Lloyd) the must-have Christmas toy, Turbo Man. But it's sold out everywhere...

programme.title: Tooth Fairy
programme.desc: (2010) Family fantasy comedy. Dwayne Johnson stars as a tough ice hockey player who is transformed into a real-life fairy as punishment for telling a child that tooth fairies don't exist.

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada
programme.desc: (2006) Comedy-drama starring Anne Hathaway and Meryl Streep. A naive young woman lands a job as assistant to one of New York's most important, but ruthless and cynical, magazine editors.

programme.title: The Equalizer
programme.desc: (2014) Thriller. Denzel Washington stars as an ex-soldier who comes out of retirement to help a teenage sex worker who's been assaulted by her pimp.

programme.title: Three Billboards Outside...
programme.desc: ...Ebbing, Missouri: (2017) Oscar-winning dark comedy about a mother who wants the cops to solve her daughter's murder using three precisely worded billboards. Starring Frances McDormand.

programme.title: Happiest Season
programme.desc: (2020) Kristen Stewart and Mackenzie Davis star as a couple who are about to lob an outing grenade into the family Christmas in Clea DuVall's darkly comic festive romance.

programme.desc: (2018) Historical dark comedy starring an Oscar-winning Olivia Colman as eccentric monarch Queen Anne, with Rachel Weisz and Emma Stone vying to become her favourite.

programme.title: The Duke of Burgundy
programme.desc: (2014) Peter Strickland's acclaimed adult drama explores two lovers' fetishistic desires and the balance of power in their relationship. Starring Sidse Babett Knudsen and Chiara D'Anna.

programme.desc: Join Patrick for two hours of spirited debate and news making interviews. Top guests tackle the issues that matter, with a sharp take on every story.

programme.desc: Tomorrow's news, tonight. All the major stories making the front pages and full coverage of all the breaking news at home and abroad with Patrick Christys.

programme.desc: Live from Washington DC, Bev Turner and Ben Leo bring you the latest from the US and what it means for Britain.

programme.desc: Mel, Murphy and Twist: It's Pete's first day at Dogs Trust, and he meets a pug facing a worrying surgery and pregnant dog who was seized at the border.

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs' Sake
programme.desc: The Potato Pups: Pete meets a litter of puppies known as the Potato Pups, who were found abandoned in a crisp box, and helps the staff fight to keep them alive.

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs' Sake
programme.desc: Dave and Olive: Pete meets a puppy who needs urgent treatment for a badly broken leg and a young Doberman who has spent most of her life in quarantine kennels.

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs' Sake
programme.desc: Colm, Ruby, Tammy... and Mel: Pete travels to Northern Ireland to pick up three stray dogs and bring them back to Essex. He also meets a Shar Pei who is in constant pain and may need surgery.

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs' Sake
programme.desc: Theo and the Suitcase Pups: Pete returns to Dogs Trust, facing a suitcase of abandoned pups on day one and falling hard for Theo, a gentle Italian Mastiff with a serious heart condition.

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs' Sake
programme.desc: Terri, Esme and the Chi Family: Pete meets Lurcher Terri, who's terrified of the world and must learn to trust again, and helps settle a family of chihuahuas given up by their heartbroken owner. S2 Ep

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs' Sake
programme.desc: Hugo and The Ice Cream Pups: Pete meets some newborn pups fighting to survive, and helps teach Hugo, a Cane Corso rescued from quarantine at Dover, how to be a dog.

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs' Sake
programme.desc: Queen Bee, Winter and Elliot: Pete helps a withdrawn pregnant Malinois regain strength so she can care for her 11 lively pups, and falls for Winter, a Staffie who is covered in scars.

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs' Sake
programme.desc: Flower, Heidi and Marvin: Pete meets Flower, the first dog ever to take a dislike to him - can he win her trust? He also helps Heidi and Marvin, both facing serious medical challenges.

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs' Sake Xmas Special 2025
programme.desc: Pete Wicks returns to Dogs Trust once again, this time for a heart-warming holiday special featuring some familiar faces from previous series!

programme.desc: When the couple have their first lovers' tiff, Gavin is so beside himself with worry that he drives all the way to Barry Island to make amends.

programme.desc: The couple announce their engagement and the families unite for a party in Billericay, but they are unprepared for a bombshell that awaits them.

programme.desc: The Shipmans drive to Wales for the wedding fayre, and after a trip to the church to hear the banns being read, Nessa tells Stacey her big secret.
